alert.note: Alert for Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 10:02PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following areas, in Alabama, Baldwin Inland, Butler, Choctaw, Clarke, Conecuh, Covington, Crenshaw, Escambia, Mobile Inland, Monroe, Washington and Wilcox. In southeast Mississippi, George, Greene, Perry, Stone and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of showers and storms with heavy rainfall will move across the area through the rest of tonight. Rainfall totals of 1.5 to 3.25 inches are expected with locally higher amounts possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
